SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

edu.cmu.cs.plural.annot
Annotation Type States

@Target(value=TYPE)
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface States

This annotation is used to declare a set of mutually exclusive states. States are always a refinement of an existing state, possibly the pre-defined root-state alive. A set of states is orthogonal to other sets of states refining the same state. Each orthogonal set forms a state dimension that can optionally be named using the attribute dim().

Author:
Kevin Bierhoff

Required Element Summary
 java.lang.String[] value
          List of state names being introduced as mutually exclusive.
 
Optional Element Summary
 java.lang.String dim
          The name of the state dimension being introduced.
 boolean marker
          If this attribute is true then objects won't change state in this dimension.
 java.lang.String refined
          Existing state being refined.
 

Element Detail

value

public abstract java.lang.String[] value
List of state names being introduced as mutually exclusive.

dim

public abstract java.lang.String dim
The name of the state dimension being introduced.

Default:
""

refined

public abstract java.lang.String refined
Existing state being refined.

Default:
"alive"

marker

public abstract boolean marker
If this attribute is true then objects won't change state in this dimension.

Default:
false
